title: ExperienceEvent Extension for Adobe Campaign
description: All ExperienceEvent properties specific to Adobe Campaign.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Profile
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The recipient of the message. This property is primarily used to link the message to a Profile using the EndCustomerId but it can also be used to freeze some properties of the profile at the time the message was sent.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Title
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Human readable name of the activity.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Channel
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The marketing channel used to execute this activity.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Description
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Description of the activity intent.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Tracking Code
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: A human readable tracking code for this activity. A same tracking code can be reused over multiple activities. For instance this could be a promotion code. That same code could be used over different channels at different point of time. All activities sharing that same promotion code can then be grouped together within a same report even if they are not under the same campaign.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Start Date
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The intended start date of the activity. In Adobe Campaign, the start date is when the delivery of the messages is scheduled to start.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: End Date
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The intended end date of the activity. In Adobe Campaign, the end date is the expiration date of the delivery. After this date, no messages are expected to be delivered. Unlike the `startDate`, the `endDate` is not required. Some activities can be *open* and so the `endDate` is not known at the time of the creation of the entity (e.g., a real-time messaging activity in Adobe Campaign).

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Message Class
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Marketing classification of the messages sent through that delivery.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Title
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Human readable name of the campaign.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Description
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Description of the campaign's intent.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Start Date
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The intended start date of the campaign.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: End Date
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The intended end date of the campaign.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Reference Value
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Value of the primary key value of the referenced entity. If the primary key is a composite key each value within the key must be serialized into a single value.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Object Type
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Type of the referenced entity (e.g., Event, Activity, â€¦). The `type` MUST be set when the reference is ambiguous. For instance in an `Event`, the `context` property is a reference to different entities depending on the type of the event.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Test Enabled
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Specify whether delivery is of type AB testing.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: From
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Address used as a from/sender/caller address. Depending on the communication channel, the `address` has a different format.  * `email`: an email address.  * `textMessage` or `phone`: a shortcode or phone number.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: To
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Address used to deliver the message to the recipient. Depending on the communication channel, the `address` has a different format.   * `email`: an email address.  * `textMessage` or `phone`: a phone number.  * `directMail`: a postal address.  * `pushNotification`: a push registration token.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Quarantine
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Address moved to quarantine. The quarantine is set to true when the message failed to deliver in a way that indicates that no future messages will be deliverable either to this address.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Proof Member
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The recipient of this message is a member of the proof group for this campaign activity.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Seed Member
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a seed list for this campaign activity.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Control Group Member
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a control group for this campaign activity. Messages to control group members are not delivered.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: A/B Test Member
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a test group for this campaign activity.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Size (Bytes)
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Size in bytes of the message. * For email, the `size` reflects the all MIME envelop of the message, including the encoded attachments if any. * For SMS, the `size` reflects the number of bytes necessary to deliver the message. If that number is over 160 the message will be delivered over more than one SMS.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Scheduled At
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The date and time the message is expected to be delivered.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Variant
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: A campaign activity can have multiple variants (French, English) but a message delivered to a recipient always contains one of them. > IMPORTANT: Using the mirror page, the recipient can switch from one variant to another (ex: switch of the language).

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: IP Address
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Outbound IP address used to deliver the message.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Reason
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The reason why the message could/would not be delivered.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Reason Message
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Reason of message delivery failure when the status is `bounce` or `nonDeliverable`.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Offers
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Offers displayed in the message.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Description
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: A human-friendly description of the URL.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Occurrence
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: URL occurrence index in the content (first is 1). When the same URL is available several times in the same content, its is necessary to track which occurrence of the URL has been clicked on.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Tags
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: A list of tags qualifying the link. The URL category is one of those tags.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Offer Clicked
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The offer and its location in the message for a click event related to an offer.
